title: Afghanistan economy under pressure as Pakistan shocks reshape trade flows

title: WB report shows growth in Afghan trade despite closure of Pak routes, Kabul seeks import cuts
description:
A World Bank document has shown that despite the closure of trade routes with Pakistan, Afghanistan’s exports increased by 13 per cent in October compared to September, where India was the largest importer, receiving 50 per cent of Kabul’s total exports last month.

title: Afghanistan economy: A crisis in slow motion
description:
The Afghanistan economy faces structural paralysis: frozen assets, weak currency, vanishing aid.

The economy of Afghanistan has become a textbook case of how politics can cripple markets and how the absence of trust can destroy value faster than any fiscal deficit. Four years after the fall of Kabu...

title: India Afghanistan trade talks test Delhi’s regional strategy
description:

title: Afghanistan seeks to end Pakistan dependence, accuse Islamabad of undermining peace
description:

title: ‘No More Trade, No More Medicines’: Afghanistan Cuts Ties With Pakistan Until Taliban Gets Security Assurances
description:

title: AP: Lakanwal Struggled With Unemployment & Isolation Before Attack
description:
Abdul Rahman Lakanwal, the Afghan national accused of shooting two members of the US National Guard near the White House, had struggled for years with psychological collapse, unemployment and prolonged isolation.
